chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell C Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 130 days served.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay supervision fees.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Court set restitution at zero.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
- No contact with HERTZ RENTAL CARS.
No contact with firearms.
*Court grants EXPUNGEMENT upon successful completion of probation.

- Cooperate with agent for all home and office visits. 
- Complete a mental health assessment and any recommended counseling and/or treatment.
- Attend any treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

timeConds.notes: *7/18/2022  Honorable Jean Marie Kies signed Order For Commitment For Condition Time.  Defendant to serve 44 days. Straight time.  No good time credit. *  To be used at the discretion of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrell C Taylor

records.addlTxt: Per Order  Order For Commitment signed on 7/18/2022; filed on 7/25/2022 which states "That a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said defendant into custody to spend 44 days, straight time, with no good time credit as a condition time in the House of Correction for said defendant's noncompliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.
ORDER FOR COMMITMENT FOR CONDITION TIME FOR NON-COMPLIANCE WITH PROBATION CONDITIONS
Order and Amendment to Judgement of Conviction in Probation Cases

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Restitution Determination (DOC-31, DOC-37)
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[ X ]   Review / Modification Request / Recommended

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Kies, Br.45 for review.

Defendant Darrell C Taylor in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Darrell C Taylor in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darrell C Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 130 days served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. 
- Cooperate with agent for all home and office visits. 
- Complete a mental health assessment and any recommended counseling and/or treatment. 
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Attend any treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- Not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
- Obtain GED
- No contact with firearms
- No contact with HERTZ RENTAL CARS.
- 80 days of conditional time at the House of Corrections, to be used at the discretion of agent. 

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

*Court grants EXPUNGEMENT upon successful completion of probation.

Filed: 
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Darrell C Taylor in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Darrell C Taylor in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darrell C Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.   Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Defense Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet
Defense Notice of Right to Pursue Postconviction Relief

Jury instructions for plea hearing

Defense Plea Questionnaire

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Darrell C Taylor not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Darrell C Taylor not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Statements by state that case was tabbed incorrectly. Court orders case re tabbed to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case was mistabbed to Br 2. Per ADA Carlson is should be scheduled in Br 45, Judge Kies.  mn

Defendant Darrell C Taylor in court with Attorney Darryl Smith on behalf of Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Darrell C Taylor in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Deputy C. Hauski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving during pendency of case.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hertz Rental Car and Milwaukee County airport grounds unless a ticked passenger.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Darrell C Taylor
Current: 2319 W Michigan St., Milwaukee, WI 53233   (Effective: 01-29-2022)
Prior: 4978 North 56Th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Darrell C Taylor in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Darrell C Taylor in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darrell C Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Darrell C Taylor not in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/27/22 @ 2:30p
